page.title: 03Ecology-Pamber Forest (ctd.)
page.content: It is administered by; Englefield Estates,who own most of the land, Tadley Parish Council and the Borough Council for Basingstoke and Deane.It at present has a full time warden; Mr. Martin Davey, {Silchester Common { }The southern portion is within our area.It is very important for 2 reasons:(i) The diversity of flora and fauna.(ii) That it gradually merges with the Northern border if Pamber Forest creating an intersting and uncommon mix of forest and heathland. Silchester Common is typical lowland heath.Its general appearance is of: gorse,broom,ling,calluna,and heather interspersed with silver birch and occasional oaks.
